relation: Thrown if there is a problem with creating or accessing one or more files needed for this operation.
Thrown if the operation cannot be performed in the current power state of the virtual machine.
Thrown if the operation cannot be performed because of the virtual machine's current state. For example, the virtual machine does not have an active recording session.
Thrown if the host product does not support record/replay functionality or if the virtual machine does not support this capability.
Thrown if any type of runtime fault is thrown that is not covered by the other faults; for example, a communication error.
Thrown if an error occurs during the snapshot operation. Typically, a more specific fault like InvalidSnapshotFormat is thrown.
Thrown if the virtual machine is busy.
textBeforeTable: Properties Destroying a virtual machine disposes of all associated storage, including the virtual disks. To remove a virtual machine while retaining its virtual disk storage, a client must remove the virtual disks from the virtual machine before destroying it. VirtualMachine extends the ManagedEntity type because virtual machines are part of a virtual infrastructure inventory. The parent of a virtual machine must be a folder, and a virtual machine has no children. VirtualMachine is the managed object type for manipulating virtual machines, including templates that can be deployed (repeatedly) as new virtual machines. This type provides methods for configuring and controlling a virtual machine. Managed Object Description VirtualMachineTicket VirtualMachineSummary, VirtualMachineStorageInfo, VirtualMachineSnapshotInfo, VirtualMachineSnapshot, VirtualMachineRuntimeInfo, VirtualMachineRelocateSpec, VirtualMachinePowerState, VirtualMachineMovePriority, VirtualMachineMksTicket, VirtualMachineFileLayoutEx, VirtualMachineFileLayout, VirtualMachineDisplayTopology, VirtualMachineConfigSpec, VirtualMachineConfigInfo, VirtualMachineCloneSpec, VirtualMachineCapability, VirtualDisk, ResourcePool, ResourceConfigSpec, Network, MethodFault, ManagedEntityStatus, ManagedEntity, HttpNfcLease, HostSystem, GuestInfo, Folder, FaultToleranceSecondaryOpResult, EnvironmentBrowser, DiskChangeInfo, Datastore, CustomizationSpec, See also ManagedEntity Extends RegisterVM_Task RegisterChildVM_Task, FindByDatastorePath, CreateVM_Task, CreateChildVM_Task, CloneVM_Task, Returned by ValidateMigration TerminateFaultTolerantVM_Task, RecommendHostsForVm, QueryVMotionCompatibilityEx_Task, QueryVMotionCompatibility, PowerOnMultiVM_Task, MakePrimaryVM_Task, EnableSecondaryVM_Task, DisableSecondaryVM_Task, CheckRelocate_Task, CheckMigrate_Task, CheckCompatibility_Task, Parameter to VmWwnConflict
textAfterTable: The guest heartbeat. The heartbeat status is classified as: gray - VMware Tools are not installed or not running. red - No heartbeat. Guest operating system may have stopped responding. yellow - Intermittent heartbeat. May be due to guest load. green - Guest operating system is responding normally. The guest heartbeat is a statistics metric. Alarms can be configured on this metric to trigger emails or other actions. layout* VirtualMachineFileLayout Deprecated. As of vSphere API 4.0, use layoutEx instead. Detailed information about the files that comprise this virtual machine. layoutEx* VirtualMachineFileLayoutEx Detailed information about the files that comprise this virtual machine. Can be explicitly refreshed by the RefreshStorageInfo operation. Since vSphere API 4.0 network* P ManagedObjectReference[] to a Network[] A collection of references to the subset of network objects in the datacenter that is used by this virtual machine. parentVApp* ManagedObjectReference to a ManagedEntity Reference to the parent vApp. Since vSphere API 4.1
